definition: a tie-break/to determine the winner
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: The two armies converge on the enemy capital for the last battle of the war.
sentences.chinese: 两军聚集在敌方首都，准备一决胜负。

sentences.english: Then the final showdown with the bad kung fu kids.
sentences.chinese: 然后结局定会和反派功夫小子一决胜负。

sentences.english: Russia is mobilizing its troops for another showdown with Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯正在调兵遣将，要与格鲁吉亚再决胜负。

sentences.english: I'll break a lance with you in argument.
sentences.chinese: 我要和你辩论，一决胜负。

sentences.english: Want to play me in basketball?
sentences.chinese: 要跟我打篮球一决胜负吗？

sentences.english: The top teams will play off seven games against each other.
sentences.chinese: 优胜队之间相互要打七场比赛以决胜负。

sentences.english: We never planned to have a showdown with anybody.
sentences.chinese: 我们从没想到过要和任何人一决胜负。

sentences.english: After years of waiting, these two bitter rivals are finally poised for the ultimate showdown.
sentences.chinese: 等待数年之后，两军终于准备好一决胜负。

victory or defeat/result
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
to duel/a duel/decisive struggle
to fight
a play-off/replay
to compete fiercely/contest
martial arts competition/tournament/to compete in a contest
victor
to wrestle
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to do battle (with sb)
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly

to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
